questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'alt' attribute in an tag in HTML?
options: To define alternative text for screen readers
To specify the image file path
To control the size of the image
To create a hyperlink from the image
questions.correct_answer: To define alternative text for screen readers

questions.question: Which of the following is used to style a website's layout using CSS?
Which of the following is NOT a valid JavaScript data type?
What is the command to initialize a Git repository?
How do you push changes to a GitHub repository?
Which utility in Tailwind CSS helps to apply responsive design?
What is a feature of Next.js?
options: Database integration out of the box

questions.question: Which of the following is a key benefit of Vue.js?
options: Declarative rendering with two-way data binding
Supports only Vue Router for navigation
questions.correct_answer: Declarative rendering with two-way data binding

questions.question: What is the main difference between SQLite and other SQL databases?
What does the HTTP method 'GET' do?
Which Go package is used for working with maps?
What does the 'make()' function do in Go?
options: Creates a new map, slice, or channel
questions.correct_answer: Creates a new map, slice, or channel

questions.question: Which of the following is true about structs in Go?
options: A struct is a collection of variables of the same type
A struct is used for creating functions
A struct is used to define new data types
questions.correct_answer: A struct is used to define new data types

questions.question: What are channels used for in Go?
What is the purpose of a mutex in Go?
options: To synchronize access to shared resources between goroutines
To wait for a goroutine to finish
questions.correct_answer: To synchronize access to shared resources between goroutines

questions.question: What is the difference between buffered and unbuffered channels in Go?
options: Buffered channels can hold multiple values without blocking
Unbuffered channels can hold multiple values without blocking
questions.correct_answer: Buffered channels can hold multiple values without blocking

questions.question: What does a rune represent in Go?
What is the Gorilla toolkit in Go used for?
What does a REST API typically use to communicate between the client and server?
Which of the following is true about GraphQL?
options: It is a query language for APIs
It is based on REST principles
It uses XML format for responses
questions.correct_answer: It is a query language for APIs

questions.question: What is type casting in Go?
options: Changing the type of a variable at runtime

questions.question: What does the term 'Full-Stack Developer' mean?
options: A developer who works on both frontend and backend technologies
A developer who specializes only in backend technologies
A developer who handles database management
A developer who works only on UI/UX design
questions.correct_answer: A developer who works on both frontend and backend technologies

questions.question: What is a common use case for WebSockets in web development?
options: For sending real-time updates between the client and server
questions.correct_answer: For sending real-time updates between the client and server

questions.question: What is the purpose of Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) in web development?
options: To allow web pages to make requests to domains other than their own
To encrypt communication between the server and client
To monitor traffic between frontend and backend
questions.correct_answer: To allow web pages to make requests to domains other than their own

questions.question: What does 'npm' stand for in the context of JavaScript development?
What is the purpose of using a CDN (Content Delivery Network) in web development?
options: To serve content like images, videos, and scripts faster by using servers close to the user
To store large datasets on a remote server
questions.correct_answer: To serve content like images, videos, and scripts faster by using servers close to the user
